mechanoreception.notes: Echinoderms generally possess mechanoreceptors for detecting touch and substrate vibrations. Likely used for navigation and predator avoidance.

chemoreception.notes: Echinoderms use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, important for finding food and potentially mates.

photoreception.notes: The presence and nature of photoreception in this family are unknown. Echinoderms can have light-sensitive cells, but their capabilities in Echinoneidae need further research.
